strings.meta.title: Jambudvipa Connected: Weaving the Threads of Civilization from the Vaigai to the Ganga
strings.meta.dek: New archaeological discoveries at Keezhadi challenge fragmented views of ancient India. This synthesis correlates Tamil findings with Sanskrit literature, revealing Jambudvipa as a deeply interconnected civilizational space unified by trade arteries and shared cultural grammar.
strings.section.abstract.heading: Abstract
strings.section.abstract.p1: For centuries, the story of ancient India has often been told through a fragmented lens, positing a series of distinct, often disconnected, civilizational impulses.
strings.section.abstract.p2: The recent archaeological discoveries in the Vaigai river basin of Tamil Nadu, most notably at Keezhadi, have provided a powerful new dataset that challenges these older models.
strings.section.abstract.p3: This paper humbly attempts to synthesize these groundbreaking archaeological findings with the vast, often underutilized, geographical and genealogical data embedded within Sanskrit literature.
strings.section.southern-fulcrum.heading: The Southern Fulcrum - Archaeological Revelations from Keezhadi and Beyond
strings.section.southern-fulcrum.p1: The historical narrative of ancient India has long been anchored in the north, from the river plains of the Sindhu-Saraswati to the Gangetic heartland of the Mahajanapadas.
strings.section.southern-fulcrum.p2: However, recent archaeology from the subcontinent's southern tip has unearthed a story of such antiquity and sophistication that it compels a fundamental rebalancing of our historical understanding.
strings.section.keezhadi.subheading: Keezhadi: A Paradigm Shift on the Vaigai
strings.section.keezhadi.p1: The excavations at Keezhadi, on the banks of the Vaigai river near Madurai, represent a watershed moment in Indian archaeology.
strings.section.keezhadi.p2: Scientific dating of its earliest layers to the 6th century BCE has irrevocably altered Indian historiography.
strings.section.constellation.p1: Keezhadi was not an isolated miracle. It was a prominent node in a network of sophisticated settlements across ancient Tamilakam.
strings.section.textual-tapestry.heading: The Textual Tapestry - Jambudvipa in the Itihasa-Purana Tradition
strings.section.textual-tapestry.p1: While archaeology provides the material foundation, it is the vast corpus of Sanskrit literature that offers the cultural and geographical map of ancient India.
strings.section.conclusion.heading: Conclusion: One Jambudvipa, Many Expressions
strings.section.conclusion.p1: The archaeological findings from Keezhadi and the textual evidence from the Mahabharata converge to reveal a single truth: ancient India was not a collection of isolated cultures but a unified civilizational space.
